intro: Pilocarpus racemosus var. yucatanus, commonly known as the Yucatan prickly ash, is a small evergreen shrub native to the Yucatán Peninsula. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and small, fragrant leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are followed by small, round fruits containing seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in limestone soils. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated for hedges or traditional uses.
